etymology.description: semantic: 氵(氵) (shuǐ, "water") + phonetic: 匚(匚) (fāng, "box") = water flowing together -> to collect, to converge
etymology.interpretation: The character 汇(匯) combines the semantic element of water, suggesting flow or gathering, with a phonetic component suggesting containment, which together convey the idea of collecting or converging, much like water pooling together.
etymology.simplification: 汇(匯): The simplified form uses 匚(匚) (fāng, "box") as a direct visual and phonetic component, replacing 龠(龠) (yuè, "flute") for a more concise representation.

examples.chinese: 他每天在图书馆收集文献(他每天在圖書館收集文獻)，汇成一部史诗(彙成一部史詩)。
examples.pinyin: Tā měitiān zài túshūguǎn shōují wénxiàn huì chéng yī bù shǐshī.
examples.english: He collects documents in the library every day and turns them into an epic.

examples.chinese: 邮局每天汇集邮件(郵局每天彙集郵件)，统一分送到各地(統一分送到各地)。
examples.pinyin: Yóujú měitiān huìjí yóujiàn, tǒngyī fēnsòng dào gèdì.
examples.english: The post office gathers mail every day and uniformly distributes it to various regions.
